metadata.title: CVE-2019-10064 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
hostapd before 2.6, in EAP mode, makes calls to the rand() and random() standard library functions without any preceding srand() or srandom() call, which results in inappropriate use of deterministic values. This was fixed in conjunction with CVE-2016-10743.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-10064` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

eapoltest - 2:2.9-1ubuntu2
hostapd - 2:2.9-1ubuntu2
wpagui - 2:2.9-1ubuntu2
wpasupplicant - 2:2.9-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wpa package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:2.9-1ubuntu2').
